newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SNB leaves discount rate at 1.00 pct after meeting.
newsitem.headline: SNB leaves discount rate at 1.00 pct after meeting.

text.p: The Swiss National Bank said it left its discount rate unchanged at 1.00 percent after a regular meeting of its three-member board.
The weekly meeting, usually held on Thursdays, was moved up a day this week due to the SNB's regular summer press conference tomorrow.
The discount rate was last changed when it was lowered to 1.00 percent from 1.50 percent on September 26, 1996.
At the current level, it matches the historic low maintained from February 1978 to November 1979. -- Zurich Editorial, +41 1 631 7340
